title: 111_hr3607
content:
The "Fiscal Year 2010 Federal Aviation Administration Extension Act" extends fuel and ticket taxes funding the Airport and Airway Trust Fund until December 31, 2009. The amendments made by this Act will take effect on October 1, 2009. Additionally, the Act extends the expenditure authority of the Airport and Airway Trust Fund. The Authority section of the Internal Revenue Code is amended to change the effective date to January 1, 2010, and includes the Fiscal Year 2010 Federal Aviation Administration Extension Act. The Airport Improvement Program is extended with amendments to authorize appropriations until December 31, 2009. The text chunk discusses the extension of expiring authorities related to funding for the Federal Aviation Administration until December 31, 2009 and January 1, 2010. The text chunk amends various sections related to funding for the Federal Aviation Administration, extending authorities until March 31, 2010 and January 1, 2010. The Reauthorization Act is amended to extend funding for the Federal Aviation Administration until September 30, 2010. Additionally, $2,338,287,375 is allocated for the 3-month period starting on October 1, 2009. SEC. 7. AIR NAVIGATION FACILITIES AND EQUIPMENT: $733,444,250 allocated for the 3-month period starting on October 1, 2009.
SEC. 8. RESEARCH, ENGINEERING, AND DEVELOPMENT: $46,250,000 allocated for the 3-month period starting on October 1, 2009. The curr_chunk is about the roles of the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the Vice President of the United States as President of the Senate.
